title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 192.4 - White pine blister rust quarantine districts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 192.4 - White pine blister rust quarantine districts

State Regulations

The bringing into, planting, possession or propagation of
plants of the genus Ribes (currants and gooseberries), unless otherwise
permitted as specified in section
192.2
of this Part, is hereby
forbidden in the following localities: (a) All of Essex, Hamilton, Herkimer, Sullivan and Warren Counties. (b) In Clinton, Franklin, Greene and Ulster Counties, all of the towns not listed
in section
192.3
of this Part. (c) In Delaware County, all of the Towns of

Andes, Colchester, Fleischmanns, Margaretville and Middletown. (d) In Fulton County, all of the Towns of

Bleecker, Broadalbin, Caroga, Mayfield, Northampton and Stratford. (e) In Lewis County, all of the Towns of

Croghan, Diana, Greig, Harrisville, Lyonsdale and Watson. (f) In Oneida County, all of the Town of

Forestport. (g) In St. Lawrence

County, all of the Towns of Clare, Clifton, Colton, Fine, Hopkinton, Parishville and Piercefield. (h) In

Washington County, all of the Towns of Dresden, Fort Ann and Putnam. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
192.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
